rename.to: Provide additional context in error messages

issue.title: Error with 5.0.0-M3 in IntelliJ

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: âœ… The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
When I changed the build from 5.0.0-M2 to 5.0.0-M3 within a project in IntelliJ 2016.3 I got following error, when trying to run tests;
```
Dez 05, 2016 10:30:44 PM org.junit.platform.launcher.core.ServiceLoaderTestEngineRegistry loadTestEngines
INFORMATION: Discovered TestEngines with IDs: [junit-jupiter, junit-vintage]
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: org.junit.platform.commons.util.Preconditions.notNull([Ljava/lang/Object;Ljava/lang/String;)[Ljava/lang/Object;
	at org.junit.platform.launcher.core.DefaultLauncher.registerTestExecutionListeners(DefaultLauncher.java:71)
	at com.intellij.junit5.JUnit5IdeaTestRunner.startRunnerWithArgs(JUnit5IdeaTestRunner.java:44)
	at com.intellij.rt.execution.junit.IdeaTestRunner$Repeater.startRunnerWithArgs(IdeaTestRunner.java:51)
	at com.intellij.rt.execution.junit.JUnitStarter.prepareStreamsAndStart(JUnitStarter.java:237)
	at com.intellij.rt.execution.junit.JUnitStarter.main(JUnitStarter.java:70)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
	at com.intellij.rt.execution.application.AppMain.main(AppMain.java:147)
```
This error even comes up within the `junit5-gradle-consumer` sample project. M2 is fine, M3 produces this error, which tells me, that allegedly a method `notNull(Object, String, Object)` was called, which doesn't exists, but I don't find no clue for this strange behavior.

body: If no one else wants this one, I'd like to give a small software engineering class a shot at understanding enough of the codebase to help with this issue.  If there is more detail on what sort of detail would be of value, pls let me know.

Hi @SoftwareInventions,

Nobody is currently working on this issue, so it's still "up for grabs". 

The scope of this issue is rather broad in nature, but a specific area that your class could work on is [ReflectionUtils](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/master/junit-platform-commons/src/main/java/org/junit/platform/commons/util/ReflectionUtils.java). The corresponding tests can be found in [ReflectionUtilsTests](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/master/platform-tests/src/test/java/org/junit/platform/commons/util/ReflectionUtilsTests.java).

Due to an architectural decision _not_ to propagate all exceptions encountered in `ReflectionUtils`, the code sometimes returns an _empty_ `Optional` or similar. In such cases, we do not want to change the code to propagate the original exception. Rather, we would prefer to log the exception (with sufficient contextual information) at its source and keep the code functionally the same.

Let us know if you need any further tips.
Of course, if you encounter cryptic errors elsewhere in the code base, feel free to propose better exception handling and/or error messages in such cases as well.
@RobLewis: Would be helpful to see just what usage case engendered the cryptic message for you.  What JUnit feature were you using that got you that message?

Hello. It was my first attempt at using JUnit and I didn't really know what I was doing. Did you see my comment on the earlier issue? It gives the best explanation I have: [https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/issues/586#issuecomment-266522369](url)
_DirectoryTest_ was the first JUnit test class I was trying to create and use. 
I'll try to answer any other questions you might have.

If you didn't see my initial report, start there: [https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/issues/586#issuecomment-266522369](url) 
Hmm, for some reason that link doesn't work. Try this: https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/issues/586#issuecomment-266522369 (appears to work). See my comments on Dec. 7 and Dec. 12. 
If you have more questions I'll try to answer them.

> Due to an architectural decision not to propagate all exceptions encountered in `ReflectionUtils`, the code sometimes returns an empty `Optional` or similar.

I did not look at the code so this suggestion might not fit the bill, but have you thought about using something a little richer than `Optional` to return errors without falling back to throwing exceptions? Maybe something like [`Try`](http://www.vavr.io/vavr-docs/#_try) or [`Either`](http://www.vavr.io/vavr-docs/#_either) (these links go to the Javaslang docs - creating a slimmed down version of these classes would be quite straight-forward)?

_Edit: links to "Try" and "Either" updated_
@nicolaiparlog Thanks for the suggestion! That might indeed be a viable alternative.
Slating for 5.0 M5 for the time being, even if only to add more context in select places within the code base in time for 5.0 GA.

issue.title: Introduce custom logging faÃ§ade on top of JUL

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: âœ… The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
## Overview

We are considering to write and use our own custom faÃ§ade. Something [like ](https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-framework/commit/47277f43da050e5f7caa30449a104082333fa318) was done in Spring.

Add more logging statements to the code, especially when it comes to configuration/setup with engines, listeners, test class/method invocations.

## Related Issues

- #242 
- #602 

## Deliverables

- [x] Discuss custom logging faÃ§ade.
- [x] Implement custom logging faÃ§ade.
- âŒ  Make custom logging faÃ§ade _testable_ -- for example, by allowing tests to _attach_ some sort of listener in order to verify that particular statements were logged at a specific log level.
   - to be performed in a later release
- [x] Document custom logging faÃ§ade (JavaDoc).
